title: Tours
text:
Optional Guided Tour Packages (18th October 2025)
The organizing committee has curated unique guided tours for participants:

Includes Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple and heritage sites.
Biodiversity Experience Package – Thiruvananthapuram
Includes Poovar Estuary Eco Visit and local biodiversity hotspots.
Botanical and Biodiversity Exploration Package – Thiruvananthapuram
Includes visits to JNTBGRI and local botanical gardens.
Agrobiodiversity Immersion Experience
Field visits to custodian farmers’ fields showcasing crop diversity and community practices.

title: Objectives
text:
Conference Objectives

Promote knowledge exchange (traditional and modern) in agrobiodiversity conservation and mainstreaming, focusing on alternate seed systems and regenerative agriculture.
Showcase innovations of custodian farmers in crop genetic diversity conservation, enhancement, and sustainable management that strengthen climate adaptation, resilience, and food and nutrition security.
Empower local governance institutions and community biodiversity management groups to localize global efforts aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and the Kunming–Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework (KMGBF).

title: About
text:
About KAbCon 2025
The Kerala Agrobiodiversity Conference 2025 (KAbCon 2025) is an international conference on Community Agrobiodiversity Management.
It brings together researchers, policymakers, farmers, indigenous leaders, development professionals, and sustainability advocates to engage in collaborative dialogue on integrating traditional wisdom, modern science, innovations, and technologies for climate-resilient food systems in biodiversity hotspots.
This event is jointly organized by: - Kerala State Biodiversity Board (KSBB) - Kerala Agricultural University (KAU), College of Agriculture, Vellayani

Celebrations & Milestones

70th Anniversary of the College of Agriculture, Vellayani

title: Thematic Areas
text:
Thematic Areas

Agrobiodiversity Conservation and Community Seed Systems
Ensuring sustainable seed networks, genetic resource conservation, and farmer-led initiatives.
Agroecological Transitions and Soil Health
Focusing on regenerative farming practices and improving soil ecosystems.
Climate Resilience and Ecosystem Restoration in Agriculture
Adopting strategies to mitigate climate impacts and restore degraded ecosystems.
Governance, Policy, and Indigenous Knowledge Systems
Integrating traditional practices with contemporary governance and policy frameworks.
Equity, Youth, and Inclusion in Agrobiodiversity
Empowering marginalized communities and involving youth in biodiversity stewardship.
